alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 5:07PM MST until September 02 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Fire Scar and areas near White Horse Canyon in Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 505 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Upper Schultz Creek and White Horse Canyon. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Schultz Creek, Chimney Wash, Upper Government Tank, Peaceful Way and Lenox-Wupatki Trails drainages. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding and debris flows in and around the Pipeline Fire Scar and White Horse Canyon areas. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and debris flows for areas in and around Schultz Creek, Chimney Wash, Upper Government Tank, Peaceful Way and Lenox-Wupatki Trails drainages * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Inner Basin Pumphouse, Agassiz Peak, Humphreys Peak, Locket Meadow CG, Schultz Pass, Sugarloaf Mountain, Dry Lake Hills, Abineau Canyon Trailhead, Mt Elden Estates, Cheshire and Lockett Meadow Campground. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash and Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Upper Schultz Creek and White Horse Canyon. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving.
